definitions.text: coming at a subsequent time or stage
at or toward an end or late period or stage of development
examples: a later symptom of the disease
later medical science could have saved the child

definitions.text: being or occurring at an advanced period of time or after a usual or expected time
after the expected or usual time; delayed
examples: tardy children are sent to the principal
always tardy in making dental appointments

definitions.text: of the immediate past or just previous to the present time
examples: a recent issue of the journal

definitions.text: of a later stage in the development of a language or literature; used especially of dead languages
at or toward an end or late period or stage of development
examples: a later symptom of the disease
later medical science could have saved the child

definitions.text: (used especially of persons) of the immediate past
examples: our late President is still very active
the previous occupant of the White House

definitions.text: happening at a time subsequent to a reference time
examples: he's going to the store but he'll be back here later

definitions.text: at some eventual time in the future

examples: he stayed later than you did
